title: 110_hr6133
content: Extension and modification of renewable energy production tax credit. Extension of Credit: Section 45(d) provisions for qualified facilities are amended to extend the deadline from January 1, 2009, to January 1, 2014. Additionally, section 45(c) is amended to include production credit for electricity from marine renewables. The term 'marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy' refers to energy derived from waves, tides, currents in oceans, estuaries, free-flowing water in rivers, lakes, streams, irrigation systems, canals, or other man-made channels utilizing nonmechanical structures to accelerate water flow. The term 'marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy' refers to energy derived from waves, tides, currents in oceans, estuaries, free-flowing water in rivers, lakes, streams, irrigation systems, canals, or other man-made channels utilizing structures to accelerate water flow for electric power production purposes. It excludes energy derived from sources using dams, diversionary structures, or impoundments for power production. The term 'qualified facility' for marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy refers to a facility with a capacity of at least 150 kilowatts placed in service between the enactment date and January 1, 2010. Amendments include changes to credit rates and coordination with small irrigation power. Sales of electricity to regulated public utilities are treated as sales to unrelated persons. Sales to Unrelated Persons: A taxpayer is considered to be selling electricity to an unrelated person if it is sold to a regulated public utility. Amendments clarify trash facility operations and specify effective dates for property placed in service after December 31, 2008. The amendments clarify that certain provisions apply to electricity produced and sold before or after specific dates. Extension and modification of solar energy and fuel cell investment tax credit. Extension of solar energy, fuel cell, and microturbine property tax credits to January 1, 2018 and December 31, 2017 respectively. Allowance of energy credit against alternative minimum tax modified. The text chunk discusses amendments to the tax credits for solar energy, fuel cell, and microturbine properties. It includes changes to the credit determination under sections 46 and 48, as well as the repeal of the dollar per kilowatt limitation for fuel cell property. Amendments are made to section 48(a) by striking certain sentences and making conforming amendments to section 48(c). The effective dates for these amendments are specified in subsection (e) of the Act. The amendments made by subsection (b) apply to credits under section 46 of the Internal Revenue Code in taxable years after the enactment of this Act and to carrybacks of such credits. Subsections (c) and (d) apply to fuel cell property and public electric utility property in taxable years ending after the enactment date, following rules similar to section 48(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
